t: Strike-Through Pricing and Savings - Amazon Customer Service
s: The One-Time Price refers to the current Featured Offer price for a one-time purchase of the item. You may see it displayed as a strike-through price for Subscribe & Save offers. If a Subscribe & Save discount is available, that will be based on the One-Time price for the same item from the ...

t: Why Amazon Workers In US Are On Strike During Holiday Season
s: December 26, 2024 - The strike, organized by the Teamsters ... pushing Amazon to agree to better labor contracts during the critical holiday shopping period.  · Large and established labor unions secured meaningful victories after strikes by Boeing factory workers, dockworkers at East and Gulf Coast ports, video game performers, and hotel and casino workers on the Las Vegas Strip. t: Amazon workers at brand new Birmingham warehouse to go on strike | The Independent
s: January 9, 2024 - Just weeks after opening, workers at Amazon’s new flagship fulfilment centre have voted to join industrial action

t: 2024 Teamsters Amazon Strike - Wikipedia
s: 2 weeks ago - The strike began on December 19, 2024 and ended on December 24, 2024. Teamsters claimed it was the largest strike against Amazon, with ten thousand workers, 1.4 percent of Amazon's US workforce, at seven locations in California, Georgia, Illinois, and New York.

t: Amazon Strike by the Numbers | Labor Notes
s: January 23, 2025 - An estimated 600 Amazon workers went on a short strike or participated in pickets from December 19 to Christmas Eve across eight warehouse locations, from Queens to San Francisco. The coordinated mobilization was an opening salvo to Amazon, and a test of capacity for the Teamsters’ growing ...

t: What to know about Amazon workers strike at multiple delivery hubs | PBS News
s: December 20, 2024 - Amazon workers affiliated with the Teamsters union are holding a strike at seven of the company's delivery hubs less than a week before Christmas.

t: Amazon workers are striking at multiple facilities. Here's what you should know
s: December 20, 2024 - Sean O’Brien, General president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters joins other Amazon workers during a strike outside the gates of an Amazon Fulfillment Center Friday, Dec. 20, 2024, in City of Industry, Calif.

t: Why are Amazon workers on strike – and what does it mean for Christmas deliveries? | Amazon | The Guardian
s: December 19, 2024 - The Amazon Labor Union (ALU) has ... Teamsters, which has 1.3 million union members across the country. The Teamsters said that seven of the 10 facilities with unions are on strike....

t: Amazon workers strike at multiple facilities as Teamsters seek labor contract
s: Workers at seven Amazon facilities are on strike. The Teamsters union says the workers joined picket lines on Thursday after Amazon ignored a Sunday deadline the union set for contract negotiations.

t: Amazon workers went on their 'biggest ever global strike' on Black Friday | Mashable
s: March 6, 2025 - Amazon workers around the world went on strike over Black Friday, demanding improved pay, conditions, and calling for the company to do better when it comes to societal concerns and climate change.

t: Dozens of workers strike at brand new £500 million Amazon warehouse | The Independent
s: January 27, 2024 - Amazon has faced nearly 30 days of strike action in the last twelve months, with more than 1,000 workers downing tools to mark the retail giant’s Black Friday event in November last year.

t: Amazon workers strike at seven US facilities ahead of Christmas rush | Reuters
s: December 20, 2024 - Warehouse workers in cities including New York, Atlanta and San Francisco were taking part in what Teamsters officials called the largest-ever strike against Amazon.

t: Witnessing the First-Ever Amazon Strike | The Village View
s: January 4, 2025 - We all use Amazon these days without really thinking about it. You get online on day one, and its likely you will have a package of whatever you wish, at a discount price, at your door either the same day or the next day. t: Teamsters union announces strike against Amazon. Will it impact holiday shipping?
s: The Teamsters union announced an Amazon strike at various facilities across the U.S. ahead of Christmas. Will it impact holiday shipping? Here's what to know.

t: Assessing the Recent Strike at Amazon
s: In the days leading up to Christmas, Amazon workers organizing with the Teamsters at eight facilities across the US launched a coordinated strike against the logistics giant. Here’s a closer look at what the strike accomplished.

t: Why Amazon and Starbucks workers are striking now, and what it means for labor under Trump
s: January 3, 2025 - Striking Amazon and Starbucks employees want union contracts. The Trump administration is unlikely to side with them on worker organizing.

t: Teamsters’ Strike against Amazon Imaginary, Union Doesn't Represent Employees | National Review
s: January 2, 2025 - The strike against Amazon was more of a publicity stunt by the Teamsters than an actual grassroots revolt by Amazon workers. These holiday season strikes are an old public relations ploy by unions, who are good at creating a narrative and selling it to reporters.

t: The strike against Amazon is over but Teamsters warn: ‘Stay tuned’ | CNN Business
s: December 26, 2024 - Thousands of Amazon workers have ended their days-long strike against the company, according to the Teamsters union. But tensions persist, with the union saying its efforts aren’t over.
